responses: Once known as Singapore’s Productivity and Standards Board, PSB Academy is one of Singapore's leading private education institutions today.  We have a diverse community of students as well as a teaching, learning and networking environment that will enable you to be a Future Maker. In 2019, the Academy was conferred “Best Educational Institute – Singapore” by APAC Insider.

responses: PSB Academy is registered with the Committee for Private Education (CPE), which is a requirement for all private schools under the Private Education Act. We are also EduTrust-certified, which recognises private schools for consistently maintaining a high standard of quality in education.

responses: Click here to view our opening hours. As part of our enhanced security efforts, our campuses are open to students, staff and visitors with a valid purpose. Please call +65 6390 9000 for enquiries.

responses: Our Open House is usually held twice a year, in January and April (subject to changes). Click here to view our upcoming events or follow us on Facebook and Instagram to get the latest updates.

responses: Mature candidates aged 30 years and above with 8 years work experience may apply for our selected diploma courses. If you do not meet this requirement, you may check with our course consultants directly. Their contact details are available on the respective course pages (below the enquiry form).
patterns: I am 27y/o with 9 years working experience. Would like to enquire i could utilize the 30y/o, 8years experience requirement for diploma courses.

responses: To enhance our campus safety and security, we have installed a SmartGantry at the entrance of our campuses, which is able to scan temperature and allow entry for students, staff and visitors with a valid purpose. If you'd like to visit our campuses, please make an appointment with a staff or call +65 6390 9000.

responses: We offer both full-time and part-time options for our diploma, degree and postgraduate courses. Working professionals who are looking to upskill or make a mid-career switch are welcome to apply with us. Browse our courses here.
patterns: Can I work part-time while study?

responses:
If you are looking to make payments for applications, course fees and other services, you may check out the different modes of payment that we offer.

If you are facing issues with online payments via Visa or Mastercard, do check and ensure you have a stable internet connection. In addition, our website is not compatible on Internet Explorer browser as Windows has stop supporting Internet Explorer browser. You may use alternate website browsers (Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Edge) to make payments.

If the issue still persists, please contact your respective Course Consultant or Programme Executive.

responses: We welcome N-Level, O-Level, A-Level, ITE and polytechnic graduates to apply for our courses. However, please take note that each course has a minimum entry requirement. Please visit our course pages here to find out more.
